skill.name: linear
skill.description: Linear issue tracking integration - Create, update, and manage Linear issues and projects using the GraphQL API
skill.summary: Integrate Linear project management directly into your workflow with GraphQL API support
skill.author: 0xSero

security_audit.summary: This skill integrates with Linear's GraphQL API using environment variables for authentication. All static findings are false positives from documentation examples. Network access is legitimate and restricted to Linear API. Environment variable access is required for API authentication. No malicious patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Environment Variable Access for API Authentication
low_findings.description: The skill accesses LINEAR_API_KEY and LINEAR_TEAM_ID environment variables for API authentication. This is legitimate and documented behavior. The skill explicitly denies access to credential files (.env, .key, .secret) in its permissions configuration.

low_findings.title: Network Access to Linear API
low_findings.description: The skill makes network requests to api.linear.app using GraphQL. This is the intended functionality for Linear integration and is properly documented. Network access is restricted to full network permissions with proper authorization headers.

low_findings.title: Read-Only Filesystem Access
low_findings.description: The skill has read-only filesystem access limited to .opencode directories. Write operations are explicitly disabled. This is appropriate for configuration reading without modification risks.

content.value_statement: Linear integration enables teams to create, update, and track issues without leaving their development workflow. Claude Code interfaces directly with Linear's GraphQL API to manage projects, update statuses, and maintain project visibility.
actual_capabilities: Create and update Linear issues with title, description, priority, and team assignment
Query project status including progress metrics, issue counts, and completion statistics
Add comments to existing issues for collaboration and documentation
Update issue states, priorities, and estimates through GraphQL mutations
Retrieve team information and available workflow states
Manage issue labels and project associations
limitations: Requires LINEAR_API_KEY and LINEAR_TEAM_ID environment variables to be configured
Network access is required to communicate with Linear's GraphQL API
Read-only filesystem access limits configuration storage options
Cannot modify Linear workspace settings or team configurations

use_cases.title: Sprint Planning Automation
use_cases.description: Development teams can bulk create issues from planning documents, automatically assign priorities based on discussion notes, and organize issues into projects without manual data entry.

use_cases.title: Issue Creation from Bug Reports
use_cases.description: Convert bug reports, user feedback, or test results directly into Linear issues with proper formatting, relevant labels, and appropriate priority levels based on severity analysis.

use_cases.title: Project Status Reporting
use_cases.description: Query multiple projects to generate consolidated progress reports, identify blocked issues, and track completion metrics for stakeholder updates without manual dashboard review.

best_practices: Set LINEAR_API_KEY and LINEAR_TEAM_ID as environment variables before using the skill to ensure proper authentication
Use descriptive issue titles and detailed descriptions to maintain clear project documentation and enable effective team collaboration
Specify priority levels (0-4) when creating issues to help teams focus on critical work and manage workload effectively
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding API keys or team IDs in prompts or skill configuration files as this creates security vulnerabilities
Do not create duplicate issues without checking existing issues first as this clutters the project board and confuses team members
Avoid updating issue status without adding context in comments as this makes it difficult to track decision history and progress rationale

faq.question: What Linear API key permissions are required?
faq.answer: The skill requires a Linear API key with read and write permissions for issues, projects, and comments. Generate your API key from Linear Settings > API > Personal API Keys.

faq.question: How do I find my Linear team ID?
faq.answer: Your team ID can be found in the Linear URL when viewing your team workspace, or query it using the GraphQL API with the teams query. The skill documentation includes a query example for retrieving team information.

faq.question: Can this skill work with multiple Linear teams?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify different team IDs when creating issues. Set LINEAR_TEAM_ID as the default team, and override it in specific requests by providing the teamId in the issue creation input.

faq.question: What happens if the API key is invalid or expires?
faq.answer: The skill will return an authentication error from the Linear API. You will need to generate a new API key from Linear and update the LINEAR_API_KEY environment variable to restore functionality.

faq.question: Can I use custom Linear API endpoints for self-hosted instances?
faq.answer: Yes, set the LINEAR_API_URL environment variable to your custom GraphQL endpoint. The skill defaults to https://api.linear.app/graphql but will use your custom endpoint if provided.

faq.question: Does this skill support Linear webhooks or real-time updates?
faq.answer: No, this skill uses the GraphQL API for request-response interactions. It does not support webhook subscriptions or real-time issue updates. You must query for updates explicitly.
